headline: Tuna Noodle Casserole II
description: Pasta combined with tuna, mushroom and celery soups; layered with American cheese, topped with crushed potato chips and baked until bubbly and slightly browned.
name: Tuna Noodle Casserole II
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of celery soup

recipeInstructions.text: Boil pasta in lightly salted water for 10 minutes, or until al dente; drain well. Return the pasta to the pot it was cooked in.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 2 1/2 quart casserole dish with cooking spray.

Mix tuna with cream of mushroom soup, cream of celery soup, milk, salt, black pepper, and garlic in a medium saucepan. Place pan over medium low heat, and heat through. Alternatively, place these ingredients in a microwave safe dish, and warm in the microwave.

Mix tuna mixture with pasta. Spread 1/2 of the noodles into the prepared dish. Arrange the cheese slices over the noodles, then spread the remaining noodle mixture over the cheese. Top with crushed potato chips.
Bake, uncovered, for 20 to 30 minutes; cook until the casserole is hot, and the chips begin to brown. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: I have made this recipe for years. Eliminated the celery. Mushroom soup only with half can of milk. I place noodles on bottom of dish. Then tuna , crushed chips and mushroom soup. Repeat. We like extra chips on lop layer for the crunchyness.
Good stand by comfort dish...I left out the garlic per family request.
used cheddar cheese soup and cr of mushroom added mozzarella and chips
Yes
My husband and I loved this dish! I added one can of green beans and it also tasted really good. The crushed potato chips on top was a great idea!!! Thank you for sharing;)

I used this as a base recipe since I liked and had all the ingredients. I used only the cream of mushroom soup, shredded cheese and no potato chips. I could just sit this on the table with a spoon and eat the whole thing!
In place of peas I used green and yellow bell peppers. It was wonderful.

This is the one! Couldn't stop eating it. The celery soup makes it tasty and special. My personal add-ins are chopped celery and onion, a few tablespoons of mayo for extra creaminess, some seafood seasoning (e.g. Old Bay) mixed in, and buttered crumbs on top. I needed a 3-quart baking dish because I used wide egg noodles. Will make again and again. Thanks for posting!
A family favorite. I added peas and used buttered bread crumbs mixed with Pablo for the topping.

We are not big casserole people but my guy was craving some so I searched high and low for one similar to what he was craving and he said it came out just how he remembered but BETTER! Took the reviewers advised cooked the pasta for less time and also added an extra can of cream of celery with a bit more milk. My addition: a can of a love medley consisting of peas, mushrooms, and the tiniest pearl onions and it was perfect!

My mom made tuna noodle casserole when I was growing up in the 1960’s & 1970’s, but never baked it in the oven. She would prepare it all in a large saucepan.

I cook now for just my husband & I since our 3 sons are adults, married & with children. So I cut the recipe in half. 

To avoid using 3 pans, I boiled the noodles (I use No Yolks brand), drained then mixed in soup, tuna, milk, black pepper, onion powder & garlic powder. I used some shredded cheddar cheese between the two layer of noodle mixture. Instead of using potato chips, I melted butter & stirred in panko bread crumbs & sprinkled over casserole. 

Covered with aluminum foil & baked for 15 minutes, uncovered & baked for another 15 minutes. The casserole was somewhat bland. Next time I’ll use 2 - 5 oz. cans of tuna, 1-1/2 to 2 cans of cream of mushroom soup, more milk, a bit of salt, more black pepper, onion & garlic powder.

My husband does not like cream of celery soup & I don’t care for vegetables in this casserole.

Thank you Chris for the recipe!
definitely dont use potato chips, they are good the first serving, then get soggy.. ritz cracker topping is much better
It was very good. Would make it again. I added a sauteed onion and 2 celery diced to it because no peas were used. I would definitely use this recipe with my additions and add peas.
Very bland even after I added peas to it.

This is the recipe for tuna noodle casserole that I made 50 years ago with my mom and that I make for my daughter and her family. Usually will switch out sliced cheese for shredded cheddar and if I ever have some other kind of shredded cheese from another recipe--I'll throw that in as a bonus--last night had about 2 Tblsp of fresh shredded Parmesan, and a little bit or Mexican Blend and they went in, as well as a bit of extra Cheddar. occasionally will get government cheese from friends who visit food bank and that cheese cubed also works well. Only thing I don't do nor did my mom. . .is to heat the soups, milk, and tuna together--I just add 5 minutes to bake time. So glad I found this one. 
 You have heard of dump cakes cause I call this my Tuna Noodle Dump recipe--If I find dribs and drabs of cottage cheese, I'll add the rest of that. . . sour cream. . .same thing. If I'm out of potato chips I'll crush some Doritos. . . crushed though only a handful. . .I added Tabasco sauce once for my son-in-law and granddaughter who favor spicier things. Sometimes I add a tsp of ground mustard, sometimes garlic--this recipe should be viewed by the creative cook as a jumping off place. But don't forget that recipes rely on ratios so if you add sour cream, mushroom juice from canned mushrooms, cottage cheese. plain yogurt, real cream etc. that you need to make adjustments in other fluid added (milk). Once used same recipe for a quick Chicken casserole by substituting about 1.5
I used corn flakes instead of chips and skipped garlic. Was still yummy!

I found this a decent base recipe. It turned out a little dry, so I'll probably increase the amount of milk next time. I also used cheddar instead of American cheese because that's what I had on hand. My husband and I liked it enough to warrant saving the recipe.

Easy and delicious! Reminds me of my childhood.
Very good recipe.
Delish!! I did add one can of LaSueur Peas and two more slices of American cheese. I cut back to 12 oz on the pasta. Yum, yum!!
I liked this very much very good no changes were made.

This is always good and hearty, even if lacking in a great deal of flavor. I used a large can of salmon instead, and also added a can of sliced mushrooms, a teaspoon of dill, and a splash of lemon juice. Topped with French's Onions instead of potato chips.

This was very good! I did most everything by the recipe and it was simple, fast and good! I added some sour cream and reduced the milk a little bit and I used crackers on the top instead of potato chips because I didn't have them.
This is my go-to recipe for this classic.
My husband and I found this to be bland. I added some onions and some peas. When I sampled my plate, I tried adding more pepper & salt, which did improve it some.
Loved it! I didn't have cream of mushroom soup, so used a second can of cream of celery. And since I didn't have American cheese, I sprinkled shredded cheddar. This was a great recipe!
Definitely will make it again. Made just as entered. Delicious--yummy

I've been looking for a tuna casserole that was close to what mom made. This is it. I used 2 cans cream of mushroom and no cream of celery. Exchanged pasta shells for no yolk egg noodles. It was wonderful

Since my grandmother is allergic to mushrooms I switched out the soups... Well, I ended up using ingredients I had on hand, rotini instead of shells, chicken instead of mushroom, cheese soup instead of celery, powdered garlic instead of crushed garlic and added a can of Veg-All (drained). All in all though it still turned out well and tasty. I will definitely be making this again. It's quick, easy, simple & cheap :-)

I used macaroni instead of noodles...I'd use noodles next time. It didn't have enough sauce for kids, kind of dry. I'd add some mayo for tang and more sauce next time. Otherwise, I liked it okay. It just needs some tweaking for my family.
This was bland - there needs to be more sauce for the noodles.
I only added frozen peas and carrots to the recipe. Very much comfort food. Great for autumn nights.
I made a few changes. I used 4-cheese Mexican blend, evaporated milk, a drained can of peas, 2 cans of cream of celery,and egg noodles. So I suppose I made a different dish.

Thank you so much for this recipe. I made this dish with my Mom growing up so it has lots of comfort factor. I lost my Mom to cancer when I was 20. Now that I'm married with kids I am trying to recreate many of my childhood favorites. Since I can't remember many of her recipes I have searched online and this one is by far the closest tuna casserole to the one I remember except we used egg noodles as a child. Thank you for posting and helping me share a bit of my childhood with my 7&8yr old girls!

This is just like the one I make, however I do not use the cream of celery or the garlic. I use a box of kraft mac and cheese, cream of mushroom, salt, pepper, (for my family that loves left over casserole) I use two large cans of tuna and two large cans of soup. Plus I add a cup of shredded cheese; whatever kind you like, we like it cheesy, and a can of peas drained and add last so they don't get mashed, then 10 minutes before its done add the crushed potatoe chips or what ever you have on hand. I have used crushed croutons, saltine crackers, ritz crackers,etc. Play with it and you will find the flavor you like. Just remember that when using potatoe chips be easy with the salt because like someone else said you can always add not take it out.
Good luck and have fun with this. This is also a good recipe to start out teaching you kids to cook. I learned this in high school during Home Economics class.

I made this casserole for my dad and I. I loved it, however he thought the potato chips were completely unnecessary and that they didn't add anything to the dish. It was great once I made a few tweaks such as adding a little more cheese and spiced it up a bit more. I would definitely make this again.

This was great! Followed exactly and the whole family ate it up! The only reason why it got a 4/5 is because it wasn't that great as a left-over. Plan on feeding 4-6 and finishing it off so there are no left-overs :)
I found out that I don't like the cream of celery soup and the potato chips on top turn soggy.

This is a great recipe! It is exactly like my mom's when I was a little girl. Times have changed. Our tuna comes in 5 oz. cans now and most people are horrified at the thought of putting chips on a casserole but I say Yay!! And Thank you!! It doesn't hurt to have the good stuff once in a while!!
Made this for dinner tonight the whole family loved it! Even my picky eaters had seconds! :) can't wait to make again maybe next time I'll use chicken instead yum!!!!
I thought this turned out really good, although next time I think I will use bread crumbs instead of chips on top.
Just made this today. Switched it up a bit by using low fat soup and milk - and adding peas and used Ritz crackers on top instead of potato chips. Yummy!

I loved this recipe, it took me back to my childhood. My mom would make this dish but used egg noodles instead of pasta shells. I loved using the pasta shells. I followed the recipe only with very minor changes. I added onion powder, parsley and a crazy salt mix instead of just regular salt. My boyfriend loved it and I will definitely be making this again. In fact, I passed this recipe on to a few co-workers who love tuna casserole! ENJOY!!

Great recipe! The second time I made it, I added some shredded cheddar cheese to the mix, one extra 'cream of' soup and a small bag of frozen peas & carrots. Delicious!

I wish there was a way to comment on other people's reviews! Some people...
A great base or just as it is. I added different soups and cheeses the different times I've made it and it always turns out delicious. No leftovers for sure.

This recipe is great as is. I do,however, add a can of mushrooms when I make this because my husband and I both love them. I also add a layer of cheese slices to the top of the noodles before adding the crushed chips. You will love this recipe!
Good basic tuna noodle casserole to get you started. Followed as is, it is a little bland for my taste.

OMG, this was excellent. I made one change and that was because I didn't have Tuna, so I used Langostinos. I can't say anything except it was just wonderful. Nice and moist and creamy, so thank you Chris, for a great casserole. Try it with the Langostinos, you will be surprised. TNT -Connie

There is nothing like a really good Tuna Casserole and we LOVE this recipe. The only change we made to this is the potato chips. We just love our ritz crackers. We have not actually tried the potato chips yet because we don't ever buy them - but nonetheless, this recipe is one of my favorite american classics. Thanks for sharing!
This is a good recipe, however, it was a little dry for my taste. Next time I will use three cans of soup or maybe a few less noodles.

I made this recipe EXACTLY as indicated. 

While it was good, it was FAR too dry for my taste and my husband agreed 100%! When I re-heated it to serve the next day, I added 1/4 cup of milk and 1/4 cup of half-n-half. When I make it again, I'll add some half-n-half and cut the amount of shells in half.
It wasnt bad, my picky pre-schooler liked it, but it is kind of bland to me. Made as recipe states.
YES!!! Just like my grandma used to make! Thank you for sharing!!!!
I needed something quick to make. Turned out really great. I was out of potato chips and substituted bread crumbs instead. Would make again.

Meh. This was okay. I added frozen broccoli, another can of tuna, another can of condensed soup, some celery, and more cheese. It was pretty bland, and I think without those additions it would have been even worse. If you think you'll have leftovers, add the potato chips to the portions that you'll eat now - as someone else mentioned, they get soggy and gross in the fridge.

Good recipe. Basic and satisfying. I was looking for a recipe that had mostly pantry items and this did the trick. You can make as is or dress it up. I added frozen peas to mine and it was great. Will make again.

Made this per hubby's request, as i am not a big tuna noodle casserole fan. Used 2 cans cream of mushroom soup, and no cream of celery. Added mushrooms, onions, and peas. Didn't have chips so used crushed butter crackers mixed w/shredded cheddar cheese for topping. Hubby and 2 yrs old liked it - so will be making again. To me, it tasted like tuna noodle casserole. :)
This is pretty good. The crushed chips overpowered it for me. The next time I used crushed crackers. That was more to my liking, but it is an easy basic recipe.
Delicious! I only changed a few things, I added peas, mushrooms and an additional can of soup. It was delicious! I'll be making this again!

I have made this for my family a few times now and each time they clamor for more. Than you so much. I do have to say I don't usually have cream of celery soup on hand but I so usually have celery so I add 2 tins of soup and a stalk of celery. I think it is about the same.

This recipe is so easy and was a huge hit- especially with the picky teenage boys. Thank everything. I used sharp cheddar rather than American cheese and I think it make it richer than it would have otherwise. I liked it.

This casserole was really good. I skipped the salt and used bread crumbs instead of potato chips. I also added frozen peas and it was delicious. I used cream of broccoli soup since that was all I had in the cupboard. It's nice that you can alter this recipe to your tastes and it still ends up tasting good.

The cream of celery in this made it smell and (if I knew what it taste like this would be it) taste like dog food. So be sure to use cream of mushroom x2 with this. Also it would taste a lot better if you added cooked onion, mushrooms, broccoli or peas, and some more spices. The cheese should be doubled as well. The chips on top are nice though.
I thought this pretty bland, even after adding additional spices. However, I think it is better the next day, so I would actually give it a 3 1/2 stars.
Excellent, but make sure that you dont add too much garlic.. I will add less garli next time.
I love the recipe. The only things I changed I added 8 cheese slices to the middle and top layer and I didn't add any extra salt. The recipe was easy to follow and my family loved it.

Made this (with a few changes) tonight for dinner. Used cream of chicken instead of cream of celery. Added some onion powder & celery salt as well. Everyone loved it! I will certainly make this again! Thanks!!
Very Good! Love it!
Delicious! Love the chips on top. Hubby gives rave review.
EASY and so so delicious! I did substitute the American cheese with Cheddar. And I did add green peas. For the chips on top, I used Pringles. It was so good! Give this one a try! =)
Super BLAH! I like the base ingredients but it needs some serious flavoring up.
Excellent!! I add extra cheese on top and sometimes add mushrooms. My boyfriend LOVES it!

This is VERY GOOD! We could'nt stop eating it! I have 5 kids and they ate it all, no leftovers!! I made minor changes, used shredded cheese and added some green peas in it...YUMMY!! Definetly will be making this again!!!

My family loved this! We usually buy the boxed tuna helper stuff and I decided to try homemade instead. I am so glad I used this recipe!
I did add an extra can of cream of mushroom soup because I read a few of the reviews first that suggested that. I'm glad I added it because it might have been too dry had I not. I used an 8 ounce package of shredded sharp cheddar instead of the cheese slices. And since I didn't have any garlic I used garlic powder. 
It turned out great! I also didn't have potato chips so we didn't do that part of the recipe but I would like to try that next time because I'm sure it adds to it. 
Will definitely be making this again!

I used Macaroni shells, 4 slices of American cheese and used sour cream and onion chips. Dont care for peas, but love corn, threw that in. No salt added, but love pepper and garlic. made a pot of white rice and put a mound of the tuna casserole on it.........uuuummmm goood!

This was my first casserole and everyone loved it. even my mother in law who doesn't even like tuna.
Great Recipie
Love it to much. Way bad for my diet though.
It was very mushy. I even followed some of the other review to help that and it didn't help. We will not be making this again!!!
Great recipe, classic and simple. I used salmon instead because my husband doesn't like tuna, and it turned out great.

Delicious! I made this for me, my mom, and my 2 yr old son. We all loved it!! I made it with one gigantic can of cream of mushroom and used 3 slices of white american and about 3 ounces of shredded colby/cheddar. (We were trying to save a trip to the grocery store). It was just all sorts of goodness...just ate late night seconds, actually.
This recipe was not very good. Very dry. Followed the recipe exactly.

used the basic recipe, but because of reviews, added pre-cooked onion and celery, topped with left over dried onion i had left over from green bean casserole recipe. Wonderful, served with broiled garlic bread. Will make again, trying potato chips
Instead of tuna we added cooked cubed ham and it was delish!
Really needs some celery, onion or something. It was sort of bland.

My kids aren't a fan of heated tuna so I swapped canned chicken breast instead and I also added frozen corn to this dish and everyone loved it. Rarely do my children agree on a meal but this will be a regular in my house! Thanks for a great weeknight recipe!

Very yummy! After reading the reviews I added in some additional ingredients (can of mushrooms, splash of Worcestershire, onion powder, cup of peas) and substituted the cream of celery with a 2nd cream of mushroom. The result was very good, will definitely make this again.
I used bread crumbs on top... I think chips will be better so I'll try that next time. Otherwise everyone liked it.

I used shredded cheddar cheese instead of slices and cream of chicken soup because I didn't have cream of celery and french's onions on top because I didn't have chips. My husband said it was the best casserole ever and even ate it for breakfast.
Very good with some fresh lemon squeezed on at the last minute

This turned out to be a great recipe! I skipped out on the chips and added mushrooms to the tuna mixture and it was great! 

Also, I live in a different country and let's just say the tuna they sell here is a little different. When I got home and opened the can, it turned out to be tuna in a tomato sauce with onions! Because of the time, I had no choice but to use it and it turned out wonderful! It added a delicious flavor that every loved!
my husband had FOUR helpings! can't beat that compliment. :)

This is a huge hit at my dinner table,.. I love it as it is the easiet thing to make and my toddler loves this.. I sneak in a can of veggies so that she gets her fiber.. also I use half the salt the recipe calls for. :)
I followed this recipe EXACTLY and it was fabulous!
This is the first tuna casserole I've made. I could not bring my self to use processed cheese or chips, I used marble cheese and crushed corn flakes. It was very good!

This was good, I did alter the recipe a bit. I added dried minced onion, and put a small layer of mozzerella cheese on top (really yummy). My boyfriend, who was aprehensive about tuna casserole went back for seconds!

I was feeling under the weather today and wanted some comfort food that wasn't going to take a lot of energy or effort to make. I did make a few changes based on what I had in the house at the time. Used whole wheat pasta shells, added corn and peas, only used cream of mushroom soup, used real shredded sharp cheddar cheese (processed cheese just freaks me out) and instead of potato chips, used a light sprinkling of breadcrumbs. Definitely made me feel a bit better (just something about making a casserole) and even though I halfed the recipe, still have a TON of leftovers.

I'd give this only 4 out 5 stars because it had a few modifications. I used wide egg noodles and boiled only 6 minutes from other recommendations. I added celery salt as a seasoning. Also, rather than American cheese, I used approx 1 cup of colby jack cheese; 1/2 cup in between noodle layers and another 1/2 cup on the top underneath a layer of bread crumbs. (I would have used chips if I had any, that sounds yummy!) Overall, it turned out delicious and is the perfect comfort food. I highly recommend!

Growing up my father would make almost the same excluding the cheese. People always tought I was crazy for adding potato chips but its the salty and crunch that it needs! YUMMY and great memories too :)
Loved it! Just like mom used to make....maybe even better!
Upsizes to serving 50 with great results!
